newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE white sugar higher but activity still subdued.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE white sugar higher but activity still subdued.

text.p: White sugar futures mustered enough upside momentum to push into positive territory on Monday but the modest volume was mostly derived from May/August switches and crossed trades.
A firmer performance in New York also helped sentiment in London but volume and movements on the raws were also muted, traders said.
One leading commission house led the way with the crossed spread trades, with the nearby May/August spread also attracting some light broker interest.
Little activity was reported on the May white premium, steady at around $66.50.
At 1705 GMT May was up 60 cents at $306.80 and August up 90 cents at $306.20. Volume reached 1,135 lots.
"There's nothing going on at all, it's very dead," one trader said.

In other news, the U.N. is said to have approved the sale of French sugar to Iraq worth some $18 million under the oil-for-food pact, with the contract involving the sale of 50,000 tonnes of French sugar.
The total amount of sugar purchased by Iraq from international firms under a December tender remains unclear, though some traders have estimated it at up to 150,000 tonnes.
The leader of Mexico's main sugar workers' union predicted that the national 1996/97 cane harvest would produce a record crop of 4.5 million tonnes of sugar.
Volume was solid on the Paris market with 959 lots traded. May was up $1.10 at $306.10 and August up $1.50 at $306.10.
